titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Champ, Indictment
CWG5137

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Garrard Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
William Champ

The Grand Jury of Garrard County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Champ of the offence of a breach of the peace committed as followeth viz the said William Champ did on the 7 Day of august 1865 in the County aforesaid unlawfully commit a breach of the peace by firing off pistols & uttering a disorderly and unbecoming manner hallowing curseing and swearing in upon and along the public highway & in a croud of good people peaceaably assembled to the great damage and annoyance of a large number of the good people of the County of Garrard and many other wrongs then & there did Against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

M Hausley
Attorney for the Commonwealth
Commonwealth
Inditement
vs
Wm Champ
